intro: Biscutella coronopifolia subsp. lusitanica, commonly known as the Lusitanian biscuitroot, is a perennial herb native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. This subspecies is notable for its ecological importance in Mediterranean ecosystems.
